General course objectives:
General course objectives
The aim of the course is to deepen the strategy and business development of an early-stage start-up.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
analyse the product-market fit
adjust the product-market fit based on internal and external feedback
identify potential competence gaps in the start-up team
identify and overcome potential intellectual property issues
understand which concepts of e.g. lean startup, MON or other pivoting methodologies applies best to different type of business ideas
apply one or several of the methods to continuously adjust the business idea based on new information being obtained
understand the interdependencies, opportunities and challenges of startups within ecosystems
reflect on your own network as an emerging entrepreneur
Content: Supervised group work on the students' start-ups.
Remarks: You need a team of min. two people. At least one founder is associated to the MSc Technology Entrepreneurship. The business ideas must have passed a first feasibility check before entering this course.
